fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6786].
  {panel}

Hi,

it would be a very usefull feature for the administrator of Jira to be able to 'become' another user for testing purpose or to reproduce errors etc
I think of a behaviour like 'su - <username>' under Linux/Unix.
You could add a field "switch to userid" in the administration interface, or add a 'switch to this user' in the users profile.

Regards
Markus Nospers

See JRA-10871 for the same request on Jira
fields.summary: Possibility for administrators to switch to or impersonate another user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6785].
  {panel}

Very recently, Microsoft went public with their blogging tool under development, "Windows Live Writer": http://windowslivewriter.spaces.live.com/

Due to MS's pervasiveness and the tool's ease of use it has the potential to become a wide-spread blogging tool.

The developers call:

" Writer is a great client for Windows Live Spaces but also works with other weblogs including Blogger, LiveJournal, TypePad, WordPress (and many others).

Writer supports RSD (Really Simple Discoverability), the Metaweblog API, and the Movable Type API.

We want Writer to work well with every blogging service out there. If you can't get Writer to work with your blog, we want to know."

This might be a low-hanging fruit for providing a well-supported and well-developed Microsoft Windows blogging application compatible with Confluence.

I suggest to give input to the developer team of Windows Live Writer to use the Confluence API for blogging.

Even if there is no direct MS support for a Confluence API, you might want to contribute a Confluence plugin...
fields.summary: Participate in development of Windows Live Writer

fields.description:
I had several Confluence spaces with lots of pages, until recently. Some of the pages were restricted to be viewable and editable only to members of a certain group. The admin deleted this group which was thought to be unused. After that the page and all child pages were no longer accessible even to the administrator. Also the nightly backup file was now much smaller than the night before.

I expected that a group still in use can't be deleted (similar to trying to delete a user that has authored pages), and I certainly expect that no pages are lost when a group is deleted.

At least a warning dialog should be presented.
fields.summary: deleting a group deletes also pages

the markup is something like
...

[ASpace:Home^A.Picture.jpg]
Display it:

fields.description:
I had originally reported a bug that produced an error message when attempting to navigate past the 10th page in the Manage Groups page.  I was directed to to this issue:

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6184

which appears to be resolved.

However, with version 2.2.8, I am only seeing 100 groups from my Active Directory server.  After the 100th group (the 4th page in the manage groups navigation), on the 5th page I only see the 3 confluence standard groups.  When viewing users, I do see most of their group membership (including groups not viewable in manage groups), although it still caps their list at 100.

Could you please verify how LDAP integration should work in Confluence?  There were a number of issues reported over the last few months, in terms of the 100-group limit -- (1) couldn't navigate past the 100th group without seeing an exception, (2) users who were members of more than 100 groups had problems with authentication, when it required membership in groups past the 100th group mark, (3) couldn't view more than 100 groups in a user's profile.

I am having a difficult time figuring out which of these has been fixed and whether the fixes involve configuration settings that we should be using.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Viewing LDAP groups in Manage Groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6775].
  {panel}

Is it possible to turn off the automatic generation of individual hyperlinks?

Sometimes this would be useful. For example, in installation docs, we often have things like http://baseserver/fullpath which we don't want automatically converted to a proper hyperlink, because we know the link is duff. 

You can do 'http://baseserver/fullpath' which seems to stop it but the quotes get displayed too.

Would be nice to be able to do {linkoff}http://baseserver/fullpath{linkoff}} or something similar.

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow automatic link generation to be turned off per link

fields.description:
We just upgraded from 2.2.6a to 2.2.8 so I don't know if this was a problem before or not.  We've set up LDAP integration which is working successfully.  Initially it was not so I added a handfull of LDAP users to the confluence-users group.  Now that it is set up I want to remove them from that and assign permissions based on LDAP (Active Directory) membership.

So I find a user in the manage users.
Click Edit Groups
Highlight the confluence-users group (which is the only non-LDAP group they are in) and click Leave
The Group moves over to the "Not a member of groups" side
When I use the "Return to view user" link it still shows them as being in a group.  Also if I go all the way out and view them again they are still members.

I will attach some screen shots.
fields.summary: Try to remove a group from a user using the Leave button under Groups Management but it does not work

fields.description:
Presently we do not validate sufficiently the text field value where user types in character encoding. For example, if I use  encoding="ISO8859-"1 and do an export of a space, then try to import it back into Confluence I get an error as described below:

-customer's comment
I am trying to import a personal space from 2.2.6a to a 2.2.7 test installation. I am receiving the following error message in 2.2.7 "Could not determine space key from contents of entities.xml" I do not understand why this is happening. I look forward to hearing back from you. thank you. 

UTF-8 works fine.

However, if I just change the encoding to encoding="ISO-8859-1"  (notice the '-' hyphen) the export and import work seamlessly.

I tracked this down to : XMLDatabinder.java :: public void toGenericXML(Writer writer)
Here the XML header is generated :    writer.write("<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"" + encoding + "\"?>\n");

This is not really validating the field. Perhaps this is not the right spot, yet it certainly should be validated before letting an user to type invalid encoding to be used in Confluence and then consequently causing problems later on.
fields.summary: Improve validation of character encoding

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6771].
  {panel}

Blog posts appear on the blog calendar's day of their original posting.  Blog posts may be edited, so they appear anew on any blog-posts macro output, but still within the blog calendar on their original date of posting (which is okay). The last edited time changes visibly in the top information line. 

It would be nice to also see immediately at a blog post, when it was orginally posted and on which day it appears on the calendar. That would give a better sense of it's applicablility, and would allow to check on other posts of the same day.  

It would even be nicer, if each blog post had a link to the blog calendar date of it's original post date, so that all posts of a day can easily be listed.  

Or, in the blog post calendar, highlight the day of the currently read posting(s).

Leftnavigation template as discussed in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6599 is in use.
fields.summary: Let blog posts show the day they were originally posted on
Make first week day of blog calendar overview configurable
Add capabilities to allow the proactive identification of offensive or inappropriate content

fields.description:
Zip files do not officially support international character sets for file names.

This has ramifications for Confluence in most areas where we use zip exports e.g. download all attachments, HTML export

We should try and come up with suitable workarounds that may be specifically targeted at our specific uses of zip files.

For example in the HTML export we could potentially work around this limitation by encoding non-latin file names somehow them somehow (integer id, URL encoded filename).

The download all problem looks to be only solvable by using an archive format that supports unicode encodings of file names.
fields.summary: Zip files do not support non-latin character sets

fields.description:
We would like to start using Confluence for stuff such as analysis documents, functional and technical designs, test designs, etc. Problem is: we need to be able to create a baseline for a selectable set of pages within (probably) one space. Not necessarily a complete space.
Basically, we would like CVS/Subversion functionality (be it using tags or by copying sets of pages) like labelling and even branching and be able to navigate between baselines/tags/branches and compare documents between them.
Looking at the current versioning support this should be easy, right? :-)
fields.summary: Support for baselines or tagging and branches. Aka good versioning support.

Create a Comments Tab to read/post comments in

fields.description:
Confluence would be much more user friendly if users could simply paste images into the WYSIWYG editor. 

This would be best if you could catch the image stream, attach it to the document and add the reference in the page seamlessly. If not, a much simpler work around could be to simply detect the user attempting to paste an image, and redirect to the add attachment screen. 

Both methods (or any other method) would need to save the page in its current state to ensure the page exists, and save any potential loss of data.
fields.summary: Allow users to paste image in WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
Improve the "Pages to Export" section such that parts of the tree can checked, un-checked in bulk.

Currently there is only a Check All - Clear All option. If a space has a thousand pages, 500 each under two top nodes, the user must manually check or uncheck 500 pages, rather than simply selected the entire node.

This could also be extended to exporting or printing a single page, so that the user can select to export or print just the current page, or the current page and all its child pages
fields.summary: Improve the Export Space pages selection to allow easy selection of a page and all it's children

fields.description:
Confluence doesn't seem to currently support nested groups with LDAP External User Management. We'd like to have a structure in LDAP (we use Active Directory) such as:

WikiUsers
        Information Systems (IS Head Person, IS Assistant)
                  Communications (Person 1, Person 2 ..)
                  Infrastructure (Person 2, Person 5 ...)
        HR (HR exec)
                  Payroll  (another person)
                  Leave Management (another person, someone else)

Such that if USE permission is granted to a particular group, all members of that group and members of child groups. This would also need to apply when granting permissions for Spaces and Pages.
fields.summary: Allow nested groups with LDAP external user management
Use Operating System Integrated Security for User Authentication

fields.description:
Most corporate applications allow Integrated Security with the operating system.

It would be great if Confluence didn't require users to log in, but used their authenticated credentials from the operating system to automatically log them in.
fields.summary: Allow Integergrated Security with operating system

fields.description:
While content is being re-indexed, users are not made aware that searches are non-functional. Having searches that return blank results or partial results for no apparent reason causes confusion. 

When a search is made during re-indexing, a message should be displayed on the search results informing the user that the results are incomplete and give an indication of when they should re-attempt the search.
fields.summary: Searches during indexing fail without notifying users

fields.description: It would be much better if you could support nested LDAP groups since my organization (10,000+) uses these since it is infeasible to have all users listed in one LDAP group.
fields.summary: Support Nested LDAP Group

fields.description: Would be nice to have the ability to add corporate logo and some text to every pdf exported from a certain space. This way we wouldnt have to manually edit these to every page being exported.
fields.summary: Custom layouts for PDF exports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6749].
  {panel}

we are evaluating confluence but are wondering if content can be organized and displayed as follows:

organization improvement
------------------------------------

content organization by score - we wish to sort data based on a numerical ranking associated with each space and individual pages within. basically in confluence terms - change the hierarchy based on numerical score.

the score should be visible to only the admin and to any user only the content would appear organized.

example:

space1 (100)
  page4 (100)
  page6 (200)

space7 (200)
  page3 (100)
  page9 (200)
  page1 (200)

space5 (300)

display improvement
-------------------------------

space should show number of (child) pages within - rather than just displaying a (+) key besides a space, we would like to show a user number of pages published within a particular space.

all types of users should be able to view the number of pages within any space.

example:

space1 (2)
space7(3)
space5 (0)
fields.summary: content organisation and display

fields.description:
Global permissions do not allow anonymous login.
Create a space, and on this space, give anonymous login rights.

Now if you log in with a X user (with no rights on the created space), he won't see the new space in the "All" List of the dashboard, but he will see it in the "New" section of the dashboard, and will access to it through the given link.
fields.summary: All users can see spaces which have anonymous access enabled, even when anonymous access is not globally enabled.

fields.description:
I believe that this issue duplicates CONF-5867.  Sorry for the new bug, but I was unable to reopen the existing issue.

When a user is already logged into jira, visiting the confluence login page from a seperate browser window launched from the "File->New" option of the browser window that is displaying jira will log the user out of jira.  The same is true if the user is logged into confluence and visits the jira login page.

Jira is installed as the standalone version running at http://hostname:8080.  Jira is running against mysql with a database name of jiradb
Confluence is installed as the standalone version running at http://hostname:9090.  Confluence is running against mysql with a database name of confluencedb.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Launch a new instance of either IE 6 or fFirefox 1.5 and clear all cookies
2) From within the browser window select "File->new" in order to launch a second browser window
3) In the first browser window navigate to the jira installation (http://hostname:8080) and log in.
4) Optionally click the "Home" link in the top left corner of the jira page to verify that this does not log the user out
5) In the second browser window navigate to the confluence installation (http://hostname:9090) which is automatically redirected to http://hostname:9090/login.action?os_destination=%2Fhomepage.action
6) In the first browser window (the jira browser) click the "Home" link in the top left corner of the page.  At this point the user is consistently logged out of their jira session.

Please note that we are consistently able to reproduce this bug when a new browser window is launched via the "File->new" window or is opened by visiting a link that opens a new window from within the first browser window.  We are not able to duplicate this issue if the second browser window is launched by clicking on the "exe" file corresponding to the browser that is being tested.

Thanks for your help resolving this issue.  Please don't hesitate to contact me if you require any further information or assitance in duplicating this issue.
fields.summary: Visiting the confluence login page within the same browser session logs user out of jira

fields.description:
I maked and used my app using XML-RPC.

And I found problem to update non-ascii(non-english) username with       groovy-all-1.0-jsr-04.jar.

I'm korean. And I inputed username in korean. In test, english name was inserted correctly. (I tested windows/linux both)

I don't know reason, but I success to input username written by non-english letter after delete groovy-all-1.0-jsr-04.jar file in Confluence.

This jar file is one of scripting-plugin's dependency package files.

So, I think you repair this error. (Now, I delete this package and disabled groovy macro in script-plugin package).

Or, update this page - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Scripting+and+External+Content+Macros 

* I use ocnfluece that maked maven compile. And language set is UTF-8.

fields.description:
See attached file, which I created from BBEdit. This has some text which (I think) was cut & paste from an email or web browser. After the number on line 3 I think there is a non-ASCII character or something. Pasting this text into a Confluence page results in the text being truncated after this character, so the final line isn't saved.

If you remove the character at the end of line 3, the content saves OK.

I would expect Confluence to strip out, escape, or barf on the dodgy character (if it is indeed such) - but not just truncate....
fields.summary: Non-Ascii character causese Confluence to silently truncate page content

fields.summary: Error when editing permissions for a space

fields.description: As LDAP is external user management, users often tick the box, which restricts their usage of local groups. This configuration option is confusing.
fields.summary: When using LDAP the external user managment option should be disabled and have no effect

fields.description:
See page http://www.schirmacher.de/display/INFO/Vexim+Anwenderhandbuch

It has links to other pages that have dashes in their page title. These links are incorrecly rendered in the PDF export (see also the PDF attachment):

Page title 

3. Anti-Virus Einstellungen

becomes to 

3. Anti\-Virus Einstellungen

in the PDF file.

Dashes in other text are rendered correctly though.
fields.summary: Dashes in links incorrectly rendered

fields.description: To fix, add "white-space: nowrap" to the style declaration of the breadcrumb DIV.
fields.summary: Breadcrumb wrapping disrupts left navigation layout in small windows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6729].
  {panel}

[9:45 AM] john kakritz: i wanted to talk to you about Active Directory LDAP integration with Confluence
[9:46 AM] john kakritz: hmm to sum it up, it appears that AD does not set the member atribute of the Domain Users group
[9:47 AM] john kakritz: rather it sets the primarygroupId to 513 which apparently is the Domain Users group
[9:47 AM] john kakritz: confluence does not recognize the primaryGroupID value
[9:48 AM] john kakritz: the effect is that granting Domain Users Global Permissions in confluence has no effect
[9:49 AM] john kakritz: i'm sure that i'm not the first person to integrate AD ldap with confluence so i was hoping that some notion of how to work around this already exists
[9:50 AM] john kakritz: http://support.microsoft.com/?kbid=275523 has some info from microsoft regarding this problem
[9:53 AM] john kakritz: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/How+to+map+LDAP+Users+and+Groups+to+Confluence+via+Atlassian+User
[9:53 AM] john kakritz: also seems to address the issue
fields.summary: primaryGroupId not visible to Confluence when integrated with AD LDAP

fields.description: Confluence allows to change the Formatting and International Settings in the general administration page. for example  from "hh:mm a" to "HH:mm". The settings work fine as long as the application server is not restarted. After a restart the default values are loaded again.
fields.summary: Confluence app server restart throws away Date/Time format settings

fields.description:
Description and patch here:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=96&threadID=12491
fields.summary: Site has grey background

fields.description: Like most properties in Confluence, we should move the formatting settings from the filesystem into the database.
fields.summary: Move default-formatting.properties from filesystem to database

fields.description:
I was trying to use both XML-RPC and SOAP with Confluence 2.2.5 from Python. XML-RPC works fine, except for not handling UTF-8 communication well. The content you get from the Confluence server is OK, but if you put the same thing back the Unicode characters will be damaged.

I am aware that XML-RPC has limitations with respect to such encodings, so I wanted to try my luck with the SOAP interface. It works for some function calls but for others it fails with the following 'duplicate' attribute error:
(There was a similar issue for Jira a year ago, related to the Apache Axis version used).

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "iso.py", line 27, in ?
    pages = soap.getPages(auth, "QMS")
  File "/var/lib/python-support/python2.4/SOAPpy/Client.py", line 421, in __call__
    return self.__r_call(*args, **kw)
  File "/var/lib/python-support/python2.4/SOAPpy/Client.py", line 443, in __r_call
    self.__hd, self.__ma)
  File "/var/lib/python-support/python2.4/SOAPpy/Client.py", line 347, in __call
    p, attrs = parseSOAPRPC(r, attrs = 1)
  File "/var/lib/python-support/python2.4/SOAPpy/Parser.py", line 1006, in parseSOAPRPC
    t = _parseSOAP(xml_str, rules = rules)
  File "/var/lib/python-support/python2.4/SOAPpy/Parser.py", line 988, in _parseSOAP
    raise e
xml.sax._exceptions.SAXParseException: <unknown>:1:474: duplicate attribute

---

The example code:

import SOAPpy, getpass, datetime

soap = SOAPpy.WSDL.Proxy('https://wiki.iblsoft.com/rpc/soap-axis/confluenceservice-v1?wsdl')

username = 'bot'
password = '*******'
auth = soap.login(username, password)

pages = soap.getPages(auth, "QMS")   # error
spaces =  soap.getSpaces(auth)           # error
page = soap.getPage(auth, 'SBX', 'Education')   # works!
fields.summary: SOAP Interface not working well from Python

fields.description:
If a user is viewing a tab such as View, Edit or Attachments, the tab should be rendered as text instead of as a link. Having the Edit tab enabled while editing provides an opportunity to accidentally lose all recent changes.

When editing a page and user clicks to revisit the edit page, they loses all changes since their last draft save. Since the Preview sub-tab view resembles the View tab view, users must remember to click the Wiki Markup or Rich Text sub-tab instead of the Edit tab or they will lose work.

Ideally, the user should not be able to click a tab they are already viewing.
fields.summary: Clicking 'Edit' while editing loses recent changes - currently selected tab should not be clickable
Create a Confluence edition between Workgroup (50 Users) and Enterprise (500 Users)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6711].
  {panel}

Macros that display lists of pages and news items format their lists in all kinds of different ways: {children} and {pageTree} are unadorned lists, {recently-updated} comes with an underlined heading, and {blog-posts} comes in a table with a heading. When trying to integrate these lists into a nicely laid out page, it ends up a hodgepodge.

It would be great to be able to ask for a set of pages (e.g. children, recent updates, recent news, etc) and specify the desired list style, possibly including some variations on the number and kinds of columns to show. At a minimum, I'd like to get any page list as an unadorned list so that I can put it in any kind of table, section, under a heading, etc.

For example:

{children:list-style=plain} - displays an unadorned list
{children:list-style=table} - displays a table
{children:list-style=heard} - displays list under a header bar of some sort (like {recently-updated} does)
fields.summary: Better page lists

fields.description: I often get complaints from users with complex document composition needs that once they break up their complex documents into a page hierarchy in Confluence (for maintainability and linkability), they can't easily print out the whole thing to read on on their commute as an example (or take an export of it for that matter). So it would be great if there was an easy to get a printable view of an entire page hierarchy. The current workaround I give them is to go to Browse Space -> Advanced -> Export space -> check, check, check... which quickly (and understandably) gets very old. This feature would therefore be a tremendous boost to adoption, as this limitation is one of the few reasons why people fall back to using MS Word for complex/long documents.
fields.summary: Add ability to easily print an entire page hierarchy

fields.description:
From Rob Baily:

When I go to the Global Permissions -> Edit Permissions button for Groups using IE I get a message saying object expected. It happens whenever the page gets focus and I have the first text box as the active field. Not everyone may get the popup as I have script debugging set up. Instead they may just see an error icon on the page.

My debugger points to this line below.

<input type="textfield" id='groupsToAdd' name='groupsToAdd' value="" size="40" onFocus="javascript:checkEditGroup();return true;" />

I looked and I don't see checkEditGroup defined as a function so that would seem to be the problem. 

-- 

Looks like a reference to the javascript method checkEditGroup() was accidentally copied here from the page permissions UI.
fields.summary: Javascript errors on global permissions and space permissions pages

fields.description:
The current message provides incorrect instructions for most users with too users, as most users only have the two default groups for Confluence and should be disabling individual users instead.

Current message:
"You have more registered users than your license allows, either:
Contact sales@atlassian.com to purchase a larger license, or
remove the "Use Confluence" permission from some groups."

Example improved message:
"You have registered more users than your license allows. To disable unused users, [search for their username|../admin/users/browseusers.action] and remove their group memberships.

To upgrade your license for more users, check out our [upgrade pricing|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/pricing.jsp#upgrades] and [contact sales@atlassian.com|mailto:sales@atlassian.com&subject=Confluence License Upgrade]."
fields.summary: Improve 'Too many users' message on License page
Search results should show the page excerpt when available

fields.description: When macros such as the RSS macro, the Calendar macro or the Repository Client Plugin make HTTP requests to servers which are down, a long timeout value is used. This consumes a thread and a DB connection, and means that the user has to wait a long time to find out what is wrong.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of timeouts for any http request made by Confluence

fields.description:
Firstly, it would be really handy if you could externalise the background colours used in Confluence.  We use a light grey as our page background colour, which means that I have to edit the site-css.vm file to change the background colour and the appropriate contrasting colours (darker grey, etc.)

Secondly, it would be great if the background (and other) colours were defined in a consistent way.  Some are listed as white others as #FFFFFF.  Some are called grey or lightgrey, others are hex codes, which makes it tricky to do a global search and replace.  Externalising these should also ensure greater consistency.

And thirdly, the background colour is also hard coded into different sections of code, apart from the site-css.vm file, making it very tricky to track down all the instances that specify the background colour.
fields.summary: Make background colour(s) part of colour scheme

fields.description:
If a user attempts to view a restricted page anonymously, they get redirected to the login page. 

Upon successful authentication they get redirected to the dashboard instead of the page they were originally trying to view.
fields.summary: User not redirected to restricted page they were trying to view

fields.description:
If a wiki page contains a username link, the link will be exported relative 

href="/display/~lars%2Bt"

and without server name, port etc. If you click on Lars Torunski in http://www.opensymphony.com/oscache/wiki/Home.html, you will get a 404 error.

Solutions:

a) don't create a link, just display the username
b) create a full qualified link
fields.summary: Username links exported wrong in HTML
